Diamondback leans over and claps her hand on his knee.
Welcome. Mae smiles up at her, proudly. Severen reaches to his cowboy boot and rips off one of hi spurs. He looks over to Caleb. A razor blade wink.

Catch.  84 He tosses the spur to Caleb. With the warmest grin Severen has ever worn on his broken The farmboy closes his palm over the silver spur. Having to grin. Homer bounces off the bed and comes up to Caleb. He reaches out with his hand. Looks Caleb square in the face.
Shake. Caleb takes hold of his hand.
Thanks. Homer smiles up at Caleb with those ageless eyes in his l boy face. Jesse looks down at the farmboy, his silver hair gleaming yellow lamplight.
Glad to have y' with us, son. Caleb gazes at him a long moment.
Jesse, there's a question I been meaning to ask you.
What might that be?
How old are ya? The Silvered One stares off, remembering.
Let's put it this way, I fought for the south.
South?
We lost. Mae comes to her feet.

Caleb, let's go take a look at the night.  85 He follows her out the door. Diamondback watches them leave with a smile on her face. Homer flicks on the television set. A late night religious program flickers across the screen Severen pulls a deck of cards out of his jacket and begin shuffling them. Jesse lights a fresh cigarette, taking a seat across from Severen. The Savage One starts to deal a hand.
The silver spur CLICKS softly as Caleb walks beside Mae a the narrow walkway of the Motel. They veer off the parking lot and head out into the green pasture behind the building.
A burst of stars. One falls. Mae takes hold of Caleb's hand.
Well you're one of us now, Caleb.
What does that make me?
Ain't exactly sure.
But it's good, right. Pause. A half smile.
Guess so. He looks at her. They walk on.
A poker game going strong between Severen, Jesse and Diamondback. Smoke hanging in the air. Homer glances over his shoulder as he opens the front doo  86
I'm going to take the air. Diamondback nods as Homer closes the door behind him.
Homer whistles happily as he walks the narrow walkway of Motel. He hears the soft CLICK of a coin being deposited in the machine up ahead. He lifts his eyes.

Sarah Colton is dressed in her grey flannel pajamas. She gazes at the soda machine, trying to decide which one have. The cold flourescent light bathes her small, heart shaped Her golden hair touseled around her face from sleep. She hits the Orange Crush button. The dull THUD of a can hitting the deck. She lifts it out. Pops it open. Turns her face to the small boy staring at her several fe away. She furrows her brow.
It's impolite to stare. Homer's face cracks open in a wide smile as he takes a st toward her.

Howdy . He begins to tremble as he walks. Sarah POPS the top of the Orange Crush can. Gulps down some of the cool liquid. It spills onto her chin. She swipes at it with the back of her hand. The boy comes to a stop in front of her. She looks at him curiously. The ragged striped t-shirt. Faded blue jeans. High top sneakers. Kind of cute dust smile. He gazes at her, all dewy eyed.
My name's Homer. What's yours?  87
Sarah.
What are you doin' down here all by yourself?
I do what I want to when I want to do it. She turns and starts for the stairs. His eyes follow her.
You want to watch TV? She stops. Thinks it over.
Heat lightning in a sky like some enchanted landscape. Caleb and Mae very small beneath as they walk hand and ha
The day... you miss it?
I'm beginning to forget what it was like. You.
I can see better at night. They stop. Embrace.
Homer smiles from ear to ear as he enters the room. A blonde haired little girl beside him. Looking like an angel in her healthy, mortal glow.
I'd like to introduce y'all to Sarah. Sarah gazes up curiously into the faces of Jesse, Severen Diamondback as they put down their cards.
Boy, you people sure stay up late.  88 Severen grins slyly.

We keep odd hours. Homer shows Sarah to a chair by the television. His face beaming with True Love and Devotion. He looks pretty silly. The others roll their eyes. The television is playing the station signoff. The NATIONAL ANTHEM reverberates around the room in a bug refrain. Sarah has plunked herself down in front of the TV and not nothing else. She giggles. Homer flashes her a look of pure love. Behind Sarah's back, Severen catches the Little One's eye wink. The Savage One slips his hand under his shirt and feigns pumping heart. Homer blushes. Jesse leans back in his seat, watching the girl, puffing cigarette, smiling. Diamondback casts a bemused but worried eye on Homer.
Homer, sweet darlin'... Homer, you look at me when I'm talkin' to you, now.
What? His voice is sharp, almost dangerous. Diamondback's mind is working beneath her good ol' gal ma
Sarah, you here with your family? The little girl tears her eyes away from the TV and the l moments of the station signoff.
Just my daddy. Jesse's gaze brushes over her small face.
What room you stayin' in, honey? Sarah thinks for a second.  89

Un, number three. She goes back to the television. Jesse gives a look to Severen. The Savage One rises to his feet, laying his cards face d the table. And slips out the door. The television screen turns to blank fuzz. Homer spins the knob on the television.
There'll be somethin' on another channel. Only fuzz. Sarah shakes her head, rising to her feet.
I better be going' anyhow. She takes a step toward the door. Homer jumps to his feet.

Sarah, wait! Sarah is at the door when it opens and someone walks in. Almost bumping the little girl in the chest. She looks up. Her eyes widen. Her breath sticks in her throat. Her gaze lifting to her big brother's astonished face. Mae just behind him. Looking past his shoulder to the little girl in front. Caleb sinks to one knee in front of Sarah. Stroking his hands across her face and hair as if to reas she is right there before him. She stares up in his eyes. Tears. Speechless. The rest of the room stone cold.
Sarah. The little girl's lip quivers.
I oughta punch your lights out.  90
Guess you oughta.

Oh... She throws her arms around him, sobbing happily. The farmboy clutches her to his chest with all he's worth His lips form words. With a smile that passes from the world of the dead to th of the living. It takes a moment before he acknowledges all the strange he is receiving.
She's my sister, people. Activity outside the door.

So that's where she went to. Gota mind of her own, that little girl of mine. I'll get her out of your hair. Caleb spins around at the sound of his father's voice. Looking into the face of Loy Colton standing in the doorw face puffy from sleep. Severen hovering behind the man like the sickle of his na Father and son make some serious eye contact. Words just don't express the feelings.
Hello.
Been looking for you.
Tried callin' you.
We been out a lot. Drivin' in the truck. Tryin' to track you down.
Dad.
Son. Severen shuts the door. Shaking his head with a savagely sardonic smile.  91
Round and round and round she goes, and where she stops, nobody knows... He throws the latch. Locking the latch. Jesse pulling the window blinds.
...But it's 'bout time for that 'ol wheel to stop rotatin'. Loy swiftly moves over to Sarah and retrieves his daughte his arms.

Who are these people? Caleb notices the others assuming attack formation agains walls. He positions himself to Loy and Sarah's maximum advantage between them. Acting as a buffer. He looks his father in the face.
I'm with them now. The farmboy shoots a knifeblade glance to the others stan around with a certain redress in their eyes.
Let them go. He returns his gaze to his father and sister.
Go.

You comin'? Caleb watches Mae's glance. She wants him. She's in him. He won't be without her. She touches him on the sleeve and that's all she wrote. Sarah watches this other woman closely. Caleb turns to his family. Shakes his had softly. Eyes firm.  92

No. But you're going'. The farmboy feels tension in the air like a trip wire on bomb. He takes his father carefully by the hand. Moving him slowly, step by step toward the door. Severen is standing in front of it with his arms crossed. Caleb looks him in the eye. The Savage One looks him back. The farmboy puts his hand on the doorknob. Turns it.

Noooooooooo0! !!! 111!!! The Little One jumps off the bed like a trampoline. Snatching Sarah in his arms. Stealing her away. The small girl kicking and screaming. Desperate satisfaction in Homer's face.
Mine. Caleb takes a step toward him. His hands out. Knowing full well the unstable little bag of bones necklo his tiny sister could snap her spine like a twig. Caleb speaks softly.
Gonna have to give her back, now.
I'm gonna nip her.
Can't do that. Not to her. Homer begins to nuzzle her neck. The Little One looks up at the farmboy with dead calm in eyes. A smile widens slowly along his mouth.
I turned Mae. She went off an' turned you. Now I'm turnin' your little sister. That makes us even steven.  93 Caleb's face turns black. His knuckles whiten.
Homer, you give her back or I'm going to hurt your body. Severen subdues Caleb in an armlock. As confining as a steel vest.
Now you just settle down there, cowboy, ‘Member which side of your bread the butter's on.

head_text.subj: GODDAMMIT ALL OF YOU, THEY'RE MY
FAMILY AND YOU'RE GONNA HAFTA LET 'EM

text: GO Now! Jesse's face has a sad gait to it as he steps forward.

Question is whether they'd let us go. They tracked us this far. Now they know our faces. Doesn't look like they'd leave off after following us all the way here. The Silvered One puts a firm hand on Caleb's sweaty shoul
I say kill 'em. Diamondback taps the toe of a white cowboy boot on the fl Looks straight into Caleb's face.

Quick. The farmboy's pupils dilate. Sarah starts to scream but Homer puts his hand over her m Loy abruptly reaches into his jacket, pulling out a .38. He backs off to a strategic corner of the room. Aiming the pistol in a two hand grip at the others.
That'll be just about enough of this shit. Let go of my boy. Let go of my little girl. Now y'all jus' get away from the door.  94 He COCKS back the HAMMER of the GUN with his thumb.
...And we'll be on our way. Caleb speaks through clenched teeth. Severen holding firm.
Put that away, Dad. Won't do any good.
Listen to your son... The Silvered One comes forward, his boots squeaking along carpet. The father trains the handgun square between his shoulder blades. Chuckles.
Whadya mean it won't do any good? I'd stop where y'are if I was you, Mister.

Not likely. Loy FIRES. Reaming a hole in the middle of Jesse's chest. The Silvered One coughs. Spitting the used bullet into the palm of his hand. Reaching out and putting it in the pocket of Loy's shirt. Patting the pocket for safe keeping. His other hand closing on the normal man's hand on the gu Jesse squeezes. Loy screams in agony. The bones in his hand beginning to snap against the metal gun in the crushing grip of the hand clamped around it. Caleb screams.

Sarah shrieks. Rage funneling her strength. She whirls around on Homer, drawing her hand back into a and connecting with the little boy's jaw. Hard. Reeling Homer. Sarah tears free.  95 Bolts for the door. Grips the knob in both her teensy hands and turns. Flinging the door wide open. Her small figure is backlit in an explosion of sunshine. New morning sun flooding into the room. Rimming Sarah like a halo. The shaft of white light burning hot across the floor. Hitting those inside like an atomic blast. Severen, closet to the door, is blown off his feet. Jesse's grip loosens around Loy's hand, the skin on his g hand smoking as he lets out a loud groan. The father spins around in surprise and alarm at the scen around him. Nursing his numb hand. Jesse and Diamondback scramble for cover behind the bed. Homer just standing in the sunlight, tears pouring out of eyes as his face burns. The Silvered One grabs him and throws him down on the car Caleb covers Mae with his body. Ripping the blankets off the bed. Keeping her shielded. Loy stands, shell-shocked, unable to believe his eyes. Sarah revolves slowly, her eyes gradually widening. The bright day framing her in silhouette. Her shadow rising up the wall of the room. She puts her hand on her mouth.
Daddy, did I do that? Caleb wrenches a blanket off the bed. Covers himself with it. He grabs his father and sister in his arms.

head_text.subj: C'MON LET'S GET TO THE CAR

text: He shephards them to the door. Looking over his shoulder just once. Mae ducking behind the bed. Twisting her hear around. Her tear-soaked eyes shooting into Caleb's face. He almost stays. Severen takes a leap for them into the direct sunlight. He reaches out with his long arms. Fingertips tearing the blanket as the flesh burns. The farmboy ducking out the door with his own. A fist of sunlight punching the Savage One in the face. Knocking him to his knees. He slams the door shut. Soothing darkness, sweet relief.  96
Loy and Sarah hustle Caleb's blanketed body to the Chevy Pulling open the darkened rear compartment. The farmboy clambers in amongst all the veterinary equipm
Go, Dad! Loy and Sarah jump into the Pickup and tear off outa ther

The farmboy stretches himself in the shadows among the me supplies. A little window to the front seat by his head. He ducks down below it to avoid the shaft of sunlight str through. The vehicle bucks like a bronc.
Dad?
Loy's face is white. Foot flat on the pedal.
What in goddamned hell's goin' on, son?! Sarah starts to cry.
What's the matter with you, Caleb? Pedal to the metal.
The Chevy Pickup RIPROARS in a cloud of dust. Dust settling on the county line of the tiny Nebraska tow
Caleb rests his head against the metal wall below the win slot. Sweating is not the word.  97

Dad... I tried calling you, Dad. You weren't home... Dad... Sarah... You got no idea, either of you. You're not going to believe it. I ain't sure I believe it myself. I ain't the same person I was. I ain't even a person... I'm sick. Loy looks through the window.
We'll get you to a hospital right away.
You do I'm dead.
Caleb... Those people back there, they wasn't normal. Normal folks, they don't spit out bullets after you shoot them. Normal folks don't burn up in everyday sunshine... Now tell me what the fuck?
I got bit... Now I gotta bite.
You're going straight to the hospital!
You want me killed, Dad?! I ain't goin' no Goddamn hospital.
Bullshit you ain't!

Hospitals fix this? The farmboy sticks his hand up in front of the window by father's face. A thin clear shaft of sunlight across the skin. Skin beginning to smoke. Loy recoils in shock. Caleb pulls his hand down and nurses it. They drive on in silence.  98 The farmboy's eyes fall on the rubber tubing, glass beake shelves of medicines, instruments, and other medical equi stored in the compartment. He fiddles with the apparatus. His mind working.
Dad, you ever transfuse a person?
The Chevy Pickup SCREECHES its TIRES up the ramp. Heading due south. The sun high in a milk white sky.

The sun like a red balloon resting on the edge of the sky Sinking behind the old homestead, cozy and familiar in th farmlands. The Chevy Pickup is a chute of dust funneling up the driv Coming to a full-brake stop in front of the farmhouse.

The windows are curtained and shuttered. Caleb is stretched out on the operating table, his skin abnormally pale and translucent under the lights. Loy standing by him in his shirtsleeves. Metal stands by the operating table with bottles attached them. Long, perilous needles on rubber tubes fitted to the bott The father lifts a hypodermic syringe and fills it with a tranquilizer. Loy looks real worried as he poises the hypo.
I don't like doing this. I don't really know what's going on. You might not come out of this.

I wouldn't want to stay like this. Loy takes a deep breath. He uses the hypo. Caleb is knocked out. The father takes a seat pulling a metal stand to his side Pumps up the veins on his right arm. And inserts the needle. Draining the blood into a bottle. His eyes begin to dim.  99 Just before he loses consciousness he stops. Looking down at the bottle of blood on the floor. Loy lowers his head to his hands. Trying to get the blood back into it. The room beginning to spin. He breathes deep. And gets to work.
A moon a day shy of being full casts a bright lunar glow the farmlands. The farmhouse sits. Everything still and quiet. Maybe too quiet.

Caleb lies motionless. His right arm injected with a needle and tube which is ru his blood out into a bottle on the floor. Bad blood. His left arm also injected with a needle and tube being f a bottle of his father's blood hung on a stand. Loy feels for his son's pulse. His own body in a state of complete collapse. There is a dull beating. It is enough to blur Loy's eyes with tears. The bottle drains. He gently removes the needles from his son's arms. He slaps the side of Caleb's face. No reaction. He shakes the boy's shoulders. Nothing. He hangs his head in a moment of exasperation.
The moon lowering in the sky. Far away a star twinkles. Maybe a star.

Loy is stroking his boy's head with a wet cloth. His own body severely weakened from loss of blood. He slumps in a chair. Trying to fight the urge to sleep. Sheer will keeping him awake. He stares down at his boy. And prays. He tries one last time to wake his son.  100 Lifting him on his chest. Caleb's head lolls to one side. Loy starts to weep. His hands trembling. The kitchen door cracks open. Two small eyes peer up. Loy snaps his eyes to the door. Sarah starts to cry.

Daddy... Loy lets his son back down on the table. A rage reddening his features. He turns his back on the boy. Sarah rushes to his side. Winding two arms around his leg. Sobbing. Loy scoops his daughter up in his arms. Walks toward the back door. And throws is open. Taking a big gulp of the new morning air as a bolt of sun falls in a clean stripe across the floor. Hitting Caleb on the face. He moans. Loy and Sarah turn. Their faces widen. The farmboy clutches his face with his hands. The sun hot on his skin. Then something happens. Nothing. His skin isn't burning. There is no smoke. He slowly draws his hands away looking at them unhurt in light of day. Slowly sitting up. Staring into the daytime sky. Blinking. Hardly believing. He's come home. From the warmth seeping through his haggard features, he' away a long time. His sister runs to his side. Eyes wandering up to his. His hand strokes her hair. The two of them in the rising flood of sunshine. Tears in his eyes. Loy walks over. Putting his hand on his son's shoulder. Smiling. Spent, wrung-out, but wearing a shiteating grin on his fa  101 He pulls his son to him. They share a hug. Sunlight streaming in as it rises about the horizon out t door.

Dawn's early light. The ROOSTER'S CROW carries across the lands like a bugle The farm awakening. Skies clearing. The screen door of the house CREAKS open. Caleb walks out into the wide open world. Unsure at first. Squinting into the sunshine. The very real daylight hitting his face. Like he's never seen it before. It's becoming more familiar by the moment. The smell of grass and straw in the air. The bright blue sky. He embraces it all with his eyes. The world that he grew up in returning to give him streng That strength washing over him. The world so simple and clean. And his, again. He takes off his shirt as if meeting the daylight head on He winds his arm around his little sister. She regards the unsinged, healing skin on his bare chest arms. She worriedly runs her small fingers on the barely discer white marks of the healed shotgun wound scar tissue. The farmboy looks down and sees the apprehension on the g face.
I'm okay, Sarah. I'll tell you what happened one day. Just promise me you won't ask till then.
"Kay.
Let's go ride a horse. He throws her atop his shoulders. She giggles and kicks up her feet. He smiles in the bathing sunshine.  102

The sun is low. The horse gnawing at the grass in the wide, open field. Caleb and Sarah lie in one another's arms, fast asleep on ground. Unaware of the time. The farmboy's eyes drowsily open. Focusing blurrily on the ghost of a moon visible in the b sky. Suddenly he sits up with a start. A shiver running through him as he sees the sun is well o way down. Day has become his friend now. Night worse than his worst enemy. Bringing more than mere darkness with it. Night still a few hours off. But the horizon is darkening. Caleb squints in the distance. There seems to be some sort of shadow on the horizonline. The farmboy blinks and it is gone. He picks up his little sister. Frightened, he wakes her up and places her on the back of horse.
What's wrong, Caleb?
It's getting dark, we gotta get home.
Why?
We just do. Caleb quickly heaves onto the horse. Digging his heels into its flanks. He and Sarah riding like wind toward the farm way, way, a The roof of the world losing its light.
Dusk drops like stone. The two stick figures on horseback gallop into the pen. They dismount and get indoors fast as their feet will car them.  103

Loy is standing by the stove. Dinner cooking. The smells seeming to rejuvinate him, although his appear remains weakened and worn down. The screen door SLAMS. Caleb and Sarah enter the room. Loy smiles at the boy.

Why don't you set the table, Caleb? Caleb smiles at the reassuring old ritual. He opens the cupboard. His eyes slip to the window as he takes the dishes down. The light of day dying fast. Loy catches his son's gaze. Sees the apprehension. Caleb is still. Day blackening.
Caleb? The farmboy shifts his eyes to his father. Erasing the memory. Thought being blocked out.
Cooling off some, huh? Almost feel the fall comin' on. A tension moves between father and son.
Days are getting shorter. Caleb looks his father in the face.
Nights are getting longer... He looks past Loy back to the window and the coming darkn A shiver runs through him.
The farm sits quietly on the lone flat land. The last light of day winks on the horizon. Then is gone.  104

They all eat in silence. An exchange of looks. Caleb eating very slowly. Sarah draining a glass of milk with a straw. Then blowing bubbles. Loy and Caleb look over. She smiles up at them mischievously. A breeze blows through the kitchen window. The curtains flutter. Sarah yawns.
I'm tired. Her dinner almost completely devoured. Loy looks over at his daughter with tired eyes.
Put your dishes in the sink. I'll be up to read to you in a minute. Sarah gathers up her plate in a small fist.
I want Caleb to read to me.
I'll be up in a minute. The little girl's face brightens. She dumps her dish in the sink with a loud CLATTER.

Don't forget to brush your teeth. Sarah groans audibly, taking the stairs two at a time. A stronger wind blows through the window. Caleb's eyes skate to the open windowframe. he rises to his feet. Crosses to the window and reaches out to close it. Something catches his ear. A faint SQUEAKING SOUND. The swing on the porch. He turns an eye to his father. His father notices the anxiety on his son's face. The farmboy tries to hide it.
Oughta oil that swing.  105
I'll wait.
Could use the air. Loy nods. Shrugs. Drains his glass of milk. As Caleb walks out of the room.

Caleb cracks open the front door. A slash of yellow light pours onto the wooden boards of t porch. He swings open the screen door. The swing rocking back and forth on the rafters. The girl sitting on it. Waiting for him. Mae's eyes like a clear, sunny summer sky. The farmboy stands there. Listening to his heart beat. His face opens in a smile. Her voice like a bell.

Hi, Caleb. Caleb's soft brown eyes float over the girl's face. She rises to her feet. The swing becomes silent. A cool breeze blows through the porch. Mae starts to walk to Caleb. The farmboy stiffens. His blood starts to pump in his veins. Hot. He quivers at the sight of her. She advances. Caleb takes a step back. Mae stops.

Caleb? What's wrong? He can't take his eyes off her. Something shatters across the farmboy's face. His eyes becoming wet. He grits his teeth. Coming forward like a rush of air. Gathering the girl tight in his arms. She winds her hands around his neck.  106 They hold onto one another as if for life's breath. Reunited. They stare into each other's eyes. Her hand touches his. She pulls her arm back like she was stung. Wrestling away from him. Her eyes stabbing into his face.

Your skin, it's warm! She glances down at her hands that just withdrew from the Caleb swallows. Takes a step toward the girl. It's her turn to back. Down the steps of the porch. Onto the dirt driveway. Her eyes blank, fixed on him. Caleb remains on the edge of the porch. Night long and black all around them.
I belong here... I miss you... Mae's eyes are ice.

What's it going to be, Caleb? Caleb starts to speak. Then stops. The wind picks up force. Mae takes one last look at him. She spins on her heels. And moves off into the night. A ferocity carrying her limbs out of sight. Caleb lifts his head to the sky. Pinching his eyes closed. Opening his mouth. And screaming her name.

To deaf ears. Eyes straining into the blackness. The girl is long gone. On the empty fields, only the CHANTING WHIRR of insects. Caleb turns back to the house and walks with heavy steps. He rips open the screen door. And goes inside.  107
Loy is nursing a cup of coffee on the couch and reading t paper. A radio plays softly on the counter. He lifts his head to his son with a gentle smile. Sees the anguish in Caleb's eyes.
Caleb? Caleb crosses to him and puts his hand affectionately on man's tired shoulder. Torn in two but keeping it inside.
How you feelin', Dad?
Nothin' a day or two's takin' it easy won't remedy. How you doin'?
I'm going to bed. Loy starts to ask. Then lets it go. Caleb heads for the stairs.
Get a good night's sleep, son. You could use it. The farmboy stops at the stairs. Looks over his shoulder with a lengthening smile.
It's good to be home. The father smiles firm.
Good to have you home. Caleb goes up the stairs.
Caleb pauses in front of Sarah's door and gives a small k
Sarah, you ready for bed?  108 No answer.

Sarah? Silence. Caleb tightens. Slamming his palm flat against the door and shoving it op A cool breeze hits him in the face like a fist. The window wide open. Curtains blowing wildly. In the empty room.

Caleb's eyes race to the window and beyond. The town of Fix, Oklahoma glittering in the distance. And then one by one the lights of the town begin to go off A last one winks. And goes out. The wind comes in through the open window. Something mythic on the wings of the wind. Caleb Colton stands by the window, staring out. His hair and clothes blown about. His eyes riveted on the black shadow of the town of Fix a the night skies. Those who have taken his sister are there. He knows he must face them. His eyes hard. His face firming in resolve.
Caleb runs from the Ford Pickup to the Chevy. All tires have been slashed. The farmboy punches the side of the vehicle. Taking off for the animal pens as fast as his feet will c him.

Caleb flings the saddle atop Diesel. Quickly buckling up the cinch. Putting the bridle over the horse's head. Grabbing a fistful of reins and hurling himself onto the animal's back. As if sensing the urgency, Diesel takes off like a shot i night.  109
Loy is sound asleep on the couch. Out the window, the black horse and its rider disappear i night.

Caleb gallops on the soft shoulder running beside the two blacktop. The darkened town of Fix lying in wait in the distance. Diesel's hooves pound the dirt. A gigantic full moon spotlights the town of Fix. In a dead black swirl of sky. The stars have been blown out. The luminescence glints off Caleb's iron eyes as he THUND down the road on the back of his steed.

A lone figure of the boy on horseback slows to a trot. Going past the sign of the town line. Caleb gives a flick on the reins. The horse walks down the street. Past the closed down burger joint. Diesel's shadow passes across the silent and still Tasty Trotting on. Caleb alert and aware, riding loose limbed, coiled for ac Eyes moving left and right. Seeing nothing. The hooves on the asphalt. The animal snorting. Silence so strong you could read by it. The whole little town deathly deserted. Like the boy is the last person in the world. Gathering the reins as he passes the Mini-Market and the Sheriff's station. All closed. Caleb thinks he hears something. The horse shies. A blur of action. The animal rears. Severen Van Sickle connects a steamshovel roundhouse punc the side of the animal's head. The horse is knocked cold. It collapses in a heap. Hurling the farmboy head over heels onto the hard blackto The Savage One hikes across the asphalt. A single SPUR JINGLING. Wearing a big old grin. Caleb is now human and the fall hurt. It takes him a while to get to his hands and knees.  110 When he looks up, there's Severen standing over him. Holding out his hand real friendly like.
Your horse fell down.
Where's my little sister, Severen?

Lemme give you a hand, ol' buddy. Severen grabs Caleb's hand and gives him a pull. Full strength. Hurling him over his shoulder twenty feet through the air Caleb comes down with a loud noise on the pavement. His single SPUR grinds against the tarmac in a shower of The wind really knocked out of him. Severen smiles. Spitting on his fingers. Pointing one of them.

You got one of two choices, you come back with us or you don't come back. Caleb sees the rangy, sinewy cowboy coming at him. A laconic stride down the deserted strip of road. His SPUR RINGING through the shut down town. The farmboy hears an ENGINE THUNDER in the other directio the distance. Big, big headlights. A KENWORTH EIGHTEEN WHEELER tractor trailer rig is coming Main Street on its way to the highway. Caleb jumps to his feet and tears off for the vehicle. Standing directly in its onrushing path. It HONKS its HORN. Caleb flags his arms. The gigantic truck BRAKES to a halt in a HISS of AIR and GRINDING GEARS. The farmboy clambers up on the passenger side.
Caleb throws open the door and climbs anxiously in. He is sitting beside a big, built for diesel REDNECK TRUC Giving the boy one heck of a serious look.
Git the fuck outa my truck.  111
Get going before we get killed! Believe me!
Gonna give you to the count of five. One... Two... Four...

Sorry 'bout this. The farmboy hits the redneck trucker in the face. Knocking him cold. He throws open the driver's door and pushes him out of th Edging over behind the wheel. Wide eyed at the mind-boggling array of gears and control

His expression calm and incredibly cold. Like if he gets his hands on the truck he'll turn it upsi down. Caleb does a fast study of the truck's control panel.

I'm going to be able to drive this truck. He puts one hand on the steering wheel. Throws the shift. He steps on the gas. The ENGINE SURGES. The truck lurches forward. Lunging like a fifteen foot high, eighteen-wheeler behemo

Caleb grits his teeth. Taking his foot off the gas.  112 Scared spitless behind the gigantic machine he is trying restrain like breaking a wild mustang. It tools treacherously and powerfully down the darkened r through town. His eyes level through the windshield at the hood of the The ENGINE RAGING in the night. Severen's head abruptly sticks up over the hood. Half of his face raked with tire tread marks. One of his steel sinewed hands comes smashing onto the ho such force his fingers put holes in it. Ripping out a handful of gears and cylinders amid geysers spraying the windshield. The ENGINE HOWLS and SHRIEKS. The Eighteen Wheeler is giving up the ghost. Caleb sees the truck is about to stall. His eyes harden. His other hand opens the driver's door.
...Jackknife. Colton throws the brake for the cab. SCREAM of STEEL on STEEL. The cab jarring. Caleb leaps out the door.

The farmboy goes jumping out onto the roadbed. Rolling head over heels a few times. Then he looks up. And sees it. Severen clinging to the cab as it skids to a complete sto The trailer it is carrying continues to travel at 40 MPH. Colliding with the cab. Crumpling it like an accordian. The air TORN with the EAR-SPLITTING COLLISION. The truck crushes like a tin can. EXPLODES into a million pieces.  113 Spreading the remains of Severen Van Sickle across half t state. Caleb rises to his feet. The rowel of the Savage One's silver spur flips in the ai over end, dropping down on the tarmac, spinning on the gr like a nickel. The fires burn down. Smoke fanned and thinned by passing WINDS. Caleb raises his head. Looks out beyond the smouldering wreckage. Through the smoke. Down the darkened street, silhouetted by a pair of headli an idling station wagon, stand Jesse, Diamondback, and Ma They are standing side by side and facing the straw haire farmboy. Caleb takes a deep breath, closing his fists at his sides Jesse's eyes blacken as they land on Caleb's face. A rage passes behind his eyes.
You fucked us up again. Caleb's voice vibrates off the buildings.

Your sister for Severen.

text: He turns a desperate eye on Mae.
114 Mae whirls on Jesse with a fierceness in her eyes.
Jesse, let him come back! The silvered hair ripples with a slight toss of his head.
Too late for that, Mae.
Suddenly the hi-beams pop on on the Station Wagon. Caleb's eyes dart to the vehicle.
Sarah takes her fingers away from the hi-beam switch. Turns her tear soaked face to Homer. Who is crawling over the front seat. Trying his level best to be charming.

Sarah, everything's gonna be okay. Don't be scared. The Little One pins the little girl down in the seat. She makes like she likes him for a minute. Curling her hand around a large flashlight on the dashboa Homer smiles lovingly as he inches forward. he wraps his hand over Sarah's wrist. And bears down. Happily. She gulps. Homer's face drifts toward hers. His lips curling back in a smile. His teeth near her neck. Sarah quakes. Tears streaming down her cheeks. Fear paralyzing her. The little boy starts to fasten on her neck. His eyes close.
Caleb's face turns leathery. He moves on Jesse.
I'm takin' her back.  115

Sure you will. The Silvered One smiles. Watching the stark form of Diamondback appear behind Cale back. Quietly dropping the pearl handled blade out of her cuff her hand. Raiseing it to throw. Jesse silences Mae with a hand over her face. Caleb keeps coming on.
Sarah clubs Homer over the head with the flashlight. A startled Homer breaks his grip for an instant. In that instant, Sarah rips open the Station Wagon door a tears outside.

Caleb almost has his hands on Jesse. Diamondback raises the blade behind her head. Mae is too scared to speak. The car door bursts open and the little girl runs wildly the street. The farmboy spots her. She spots Diamondback in the nick of time.

Caleb!!! Look out!!! Caleb ducks. Diamondback throws the knife. It plunges through the air. Imbedding in Jesse's face. The Pale One gasps. The Silvered One snarls in anger, pulling out the blade. Caleb dives through the burning wreckage of the truck to his baby sister up in his arms and carry her off into the Jesse takes one handed aim on their fleeing figures with Colt Peacemaker. Finger closing on the trigger. Mae knocks into him as the gun GOES OFF. Bullet hitting air. The Silvered One whirls on the girl in a red-faced rage. She averts her eyes.
Caleb takes off into the flatlands that surround the town  116 Sarah in his arms with her own arms wrapped around his ne Burying her scared face in his chest. Full moon high and mighty.

Jesse squints into the fields and sees them hurrying off. He bounds to the Station Wagon and shoves Diamondback in alongside Homer. Mae stands alone on the road. Her face a maze of emotions. The Silvered One slides behind the wheel and REVS on the HONKS the HORN.
She hesitates. Her eyes spill with tears as she ducks into the car. It takes off in a SCREECH of TIRES. Rocketing off the road.

The distant frantic YIPPING of coyotes. Tall grasses bending in the wind. Dust trailing up beneath Caleb's footsteps as he plunders forward. A flat black twist of sky that shows signs of paling at t edges. Sarah is tight in his arms. His breathing in loud gasps. He gulps air. The terrain dipping and rising. Holes and ruts. He trips. Falling face first in the dirt. Sarah goes sprawling to the ground in a heap.

Keep running! Sarah races off. Caleb scrambles to his feet. A shattering pain in his leg. He clutches his ankle. Watching the little girl go. Moonlight glistening on her shiny blonde hair as it flows air with her flight. The farmboy staggers after her.  117 Losing sight of her in the darkness of night.

The vehicle pitches and leaps over the rough land. Two white cones of light floating over the ground. Dust rising in the headlights. Then the figure of a small girl. Running. Smack into the light. Suddenly stopping. Pinned in the lights.
Caleb, running with a limp, scans the blackened land. He forages ahead. Listening to a lone shrill cry beneath a slowly brighteni
Caleb swings his head around. Sees a pair of red taillights streaking toward the highwa the distance. His face explodes in a bloodthirsty scream.

Jesse's hands tighten around the wheel as he accelerates the road. Diamondback glances toward the back seat. Homer hugs a struggling breathless Sarah to his chest. Face beaming. Mae turns her eys to the back window. Jesse's gaze flits to the sky.
We'll take care of him later. No time now. He steers the vehicle up over the last of the fields and onto the tarmac. The Wagon picks up speed.

Caleb lurches onto the highway.  118 In a dead run. Mouth sucking air. Feet pounding the pavement. The taillights moving steadily down the blacktop. He looks up at the sky. Growing paler by the minute. He shakes his fists at the coming day as if beckoning it

Mae's eyes still holding out the back window. She sees the speck that is Caleb running after them. Rapidly receding. An agony races behind her gaze. She glances over at Sarah. Homer holding a hand over the little girl's mouth and pus the hair from the sun warmed skin of her neck. Mae turns back to the window.
Streaks of light bleaching the sky. Caleb scrambling along the blacktop and broken white line Running full steam ahead after the speeding Station Wagon Lungs almost bursting.

Jesse looks worried as he eyes the sky. Mae returns her sight to Caleb, a mere spot on the road. Something in her erupts. She leaps out of her seat. Ripping Sarah from Homer's grasp. Scrambling over the backseat. Smashing her arm into the back window. Glass spiderwebbing. She dives out of the moving vehicle with the little girl arms.

Sunrise. Mae slams onto the pavement. Shielding Sarah from the impact with her body. The Station Wagon brakes in an ear-splitting SCREECH of T Mae and Sarah claw to their feet and start to run to Cale Sunlight beginning to singe Mae's skin. Caleb's face widens in an unbelieving stare. He takes off for them as fast as his feet will carry him. Lungs bleeding. Mae and Sarah putting some yardage between them and the W  119 Caleb getting close. From out of the rear window of the Station Wagon, Homer a Leaping onto the pavement and breaking into a dead run. Skin beginning to smoke. Mae's skin starting to smoke. Her eyes starting to close. Her feet staggering along the asphalt. The sun cresting the rim of the world. A wall of light like a blazing wave. Her eyes roll up in their sockets. Sarah scampers with all her strength toward her approachi brother. Homer overtakes Mae, screaming in anguish. His hands stretch out to snatch Sarah. Shimmering rays of sun alighting on his body. Igniting like the head of a match. The sparks licking into the air. Then dissolving into pure ash. Inches away from the little girl. As she throws her arms around her brother. And he sweeps her up in his own. Mae is smoking in the sun. Her legs give out from under her. She collapses on the pavement. An ENGINE NOISE makes him lift his head. He looks into the nose of the Station Wagon bearing down He sucks wind. Shouts to his sister.

A venom passes between that look. The sun rising in the sky. Heating up the blacktop. Caleb folds his arms around the still body of Mae on the A single tear drops to the dust. The light grows bright. Roast...! The daylight, like a nuclear afterburn, ripping through t transparent windshield. Hitting Jesse square in the chest. A fire begins to glow in the driver's seat. A fire that was Jesse Hooker. The Station Wagon blows to smithereens. A silence falls. The lone road stretching for miles and miles. Sunlight rising up over the land. A shaken farmboy huddles on top of the young girl in the of the road. A little girl comes over and cries into her big brother's A small fire burns beside a larger fire. Smoke curling up. A gentle breeze blowing down. THE SCREEN SLOWLY FADES TO COMPLETE BLACKNESS. NOTHING BUT DARK.

Blinding eruption of blazing daylight. A pair of hands have thrown open the shutters. The sun so high in the sky splashing the room with light. Caleb stands aside, anxiously watching someone on the tab Mae is spread out. The blood transfusion apparatus rising above her. A bandage on her arm. I'll show you. He takes her by the hand. Mae blinks with the attitude of a newborn infant. Not believing she is still alive in the face of the sun. Getting off the table, she walks with Caleb to the window stands. Gazing out in wonderment at the sprawling fields and sunn flatlands. The bruises and welts on her face are beginning to heal. There is a tear in her eye as she looks over to Caleb.
C'mon outside. She goes with him out the door.

A wall of sunlight on the pastoral fields at high noon. The animals in the pens. Dogs scampering about. Caleb walks through the fields with Mae on his arm. She just starts giggling. Looking around her. Smelling the fresh air. Seeing all the daytime farm sights. Caleb puts his arm around her. He's been there.

Kinda nice, huh? They lean back against a fence. Their eyes meet. And their lips. A loving embrace. Long and warm.  122 The farmhouse small behind them. The front door opening. Somebody small, smiling out. Sarah taking off in a dead run for her brother. Beneath the bright sun in a talcum blue sky. She yelps. Jumps back inside. Recoiling into the cooling darkness of the farmhouse. Looking at the wisp of smoke rising from the skin of her FADE OUT.
